formalText: She doesn't want to sleep. Sleep brings nightmares with it and she has the same nightmare over and over.
She was wondering if she could get something to help her sleep and forget past events.
She would like to get help because she feels like she can't live her life.
She's not wanting to be around groups of people.
She feels irritable and has been having trouble concentrating and remembering things.
She doesn't have an appetite and feels nauseated a lot lately.
She's 28 years old and feels like an old lady.
She has had nightmares for years throughout her childhood.

And now she's 28 and still having them and she never likes sleep and tries to avoid it. She needs only about 5 hours a night and her anxious and irritable feelings have increased more in the last few months.
She noticed her nausea and loss of appetite since the separation from her husband and since moving into her grandparents house again.

She believes this all began with a panic attack. She thought she was having a heart issues but realized that she was having a panic attack. She just figured it was due to the split with her husband and moving back to her hometown and into the old house.
She feels that she has less patience with her daughters and she also feels that she spaces out more. She's having a hard time concentrating and sticking with tasks.
She has always been mildly more sad than usual.
She feels like she is suffocating and she needs space.
She wants to be alone.
She had the panic attack and she doesn't feel entirely safe in the house.
She's scared of something happening to her daughters and she will not be able to protect them.
She wakes up from her nightmares and feels an overwhelming sense that she can't protect them.
She goes to check on them after her heart slows and her shaking quits from The Nightmare.
Someone is in the house chasing her and she needs to save her family before he gets to them and kills them all. They are dark dreams so she doesn't share with anyone outside of counseling.
She learned her dreams were not normal dreams when she was growing up.
She wakes up in a sweat, out of breath and her heart racing.
She avoids napping.
She worries about her daughters being harmed.
Her life just went downhill.
She used to have to play with her cousin in the basement.
He was not a nice person. He was five years older than her and liked to teach her all sorts of things- sexual things.
She was only five at the time and didn't understand.
She felt dirty and ashamed and she didn't tell anyone until she was an adult.
She's gone to counseling for this as an adult.
Suicide was a thought as she was growing up, but she couldn't leave her girls when her parents divorced.
She wanted to die.
When she was a teenager, she would take a bunch of pills or just get into her mom's car and turn it on and go to sleep in the closed garage.
That was when she was in junior high and high school.
She smoked cigarettes, a pack a day. It started when she quit alcohol.
She went through treatment for her drinking and has been sober for eight years.
No drug use.
She just moved back to town this last year with her two young daughters.
She's living at her grandparents house.
They have both passed.
She noticed after she moved and that she doesn't feel settled and she has the symptoms.
She grew up with her step dad abusing her mom.
Her mom was pretty physical.
She would get beat then the kids would get beat.
It was just messed up.
One of her daughters is 5 and one is 7. They are good girls.
Her mom was a yeller and through things she cursed a lot and was not a happy person.
She had her when she was 16.
So they always kind of clashed.
Her husband was also a yeller and controller. He means to protect her, but it goes too far.
Her Mom married an alcoholic that beat her and then she beat them. The cops were at her house a lot to break up the fighting.
They didn't eat well or often and she usually cooked for her sister and brother because her mom and stepdad were at the bar.
She missed her dad.
He never raised his voice or hit her once.
Her mom was depressed and has issues.
She's never been treated.
Her dad is fine.
No problems.
No other medical issues that she knows of.
